sentence: modern textbook theories of what used to be called the assignment problem suggest that when an economy is open to international trade and capital flows, with flexible exchange rates, as is the u.s. economy, fiscal policy should be used to set the long-term or normal saving rate, and monetary policy should be used to stabilize the economy.

sentence: this rule would have the fed setting short-term interest rates equal to an equilibrium nominal short rate, plus a term of forcing up nominal rates if inflation rises and a term of forcing down nominal rates if unemployment rises.
